sourceDesc.p: Born digital. Information on original sources for transcriptions can be accessed via the transcriptions.

projectDesc.p: The Fortune Theatre Reecords: A Prototype Digital Edition is the outcome of a project exploring methods and means for the publication of Records of Early English Drama (REED) collections in a digital format.

editorialDecl.p: Do we want to use this for the Editorial Procedures section of the REED collection apparatus?

namespace.tagUsage: Used to enclose cancelled text in record transcriptions. At-code practise: cancelled text enclosed in square brackets ([...]).

refsDecl.p: For infomation on attribues and values.

div.ab: Memorandum That Iohn Shauncke late of the parish of St Botolph without Aldersgate London deceased did on or about the first day of December In the yeare of our Lord One thousand sixe hundred fifty five, he then being (though sicke in body) of perfect mind, memory and vnderstanding and having an intent and purpose to settle or dispose of his estate, make and declare his last Will and testament Nuncupative in manner and forme following, videlicet videlicet: in italic script; He gave and bequeathed all that he had and whatsoever was due vnto him vnto Henry Hasard of the parish of St Iames Clarkenwell in the County of Middlesex gentleman, whom he the sayd deceased desired to haue a care to bury him; Which words or the like in effect he did nuncupate and declare with a mind of making his Will in the presence of divers credible wittnesses.
On the first of August 1656 The sayd Henry Gery and Richard Wright were sworn upon the truth of the abovewritten Nuncupative will
Henry Geery &
Richard wright sworne
before me G Cock
Administracion past seale &c dated 10th September 1656 1656: underlined.

head.title: Administration Grant of Richard Gunnell’s Will

ab.note: Richardus Gunnell Administration of goods unadministred granted in September 1654. 1654: underlined

row.cell: Decimo octavo die die: ie, of October emanavit Comissio Elizabethe Gunnell Relicte Richardi Gunnell nuper parochie sancte Bridgitte in ffleetstreete London defuncti habentis &c ad administrandum bona iura et credita dicti defuncti De bene &c iurate

Londoniensis
Inventorium
exhibitum 2do Land
9 li.

head.title: Administration Grant of Richard Gunnell’s Will

ab.note: former Administracion grant in October 1634. 1634: 1634: underlined; 34 written over other numbers

div.ab: The nyne and twentieth day letters of Administracion issued out vnto Margarett Wintershull alias Gunnell ye d naturall and lawfull daughter of Richard Gunnell late of ye parish of st Brides in London deceased, To Administer ye goods Chattells and debts of ye said deceased which were left vnadministerd by Elizabeth Gunnell ye relict of ye said deceased she ye said Margaret Wintershull alias Gunnell being first sworne well and truly to Administer &c
Inventory last October

head.title: Commissary Court Probate and Admission Acts

row.cell: Eodem die Eodem die: 11 May emanavit commissio Elizabethe Relicte Petri Streete nuper de Precincto le Blackfriers ab intestato defuncto Ad admininstrandum bonis dicti defuncti De bene &c Ac die pleno &c Necnon de vero &c Iurata &c Saluo iure &c

Ciuitas Londinij
Iohannis ffidis Inuentorium exhibitum
cum Computo

div.ab: Memorandum quod quinto die ffebruarij Anno Regni domini nostri Iacobi Dei gracia regis Anglie &c. octavo et Scotie xliiijto coram me Nicholao Collyn Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in comitatu Middlesexie &c. Edwardus Hippwell sancti Dunstani in Occidente London Taylor Thomas Hipwell de perochia sancte Marie Abchurche London Carpenter et Thomas Bradford de parochia sancti Bartholomei le grand London Cooke manuceperunt pro Stephano Hipwell serviente Richardo Kinge de dicta parochia sancte Marie Abchurche London carpenter procarpenter: underlined quod comparebit ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro dicto comitatu Middlesexie tenendam ad respondendum omnibus &c. vizt. quilibet manucaptorum predictorum sub pena xxx libras quas &c.

Bound ouer for Misdemeaninge himselfe vppon Shrovemunday
Last at the playhouse called the fortune

Memorandum that on 5 February in the eighth year of the reign of our lord James by the grace of God king of England, etc, and the forty-fourth year (of his reign) of Scotland, before me, Nicholas Collyn, esquire, one of the said lord king's justices of the peace in the county of Middlesex, etc, came Edward Hippwell, tailor of St Dunstan in west London, Thomas Hipwell, carpenter of the parish of St Mary Abchurch, and Thomas Bradford, cook of the parish of St Bartholomew the Great, London, gave surety on behalf of Stephen Hipwell, servant of Richard Kinge, carpenter of the said parish of St Mary Abchurch , that he will appear at the next session of the peace to be held for the said county of Middlesex to respond to all, etc, that is to say, each of the aforesaid manucaptors under the penalty of £30, which, etc.
For Stephen Hippwell 's appearances at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 339.

memorandum quod xxvjto die ffebruarij Anno regni domini nostri Iacobi dei gracia Regis Anglie &c. viijo & Scotie xliiijto venerunt coram nobis Lodovico Lewkenour & Roberto Leigh militibus duobus Iusticiariorum pacis in Comitatu predicto conservandam assignatorum &c. Iohannes Shawe de Grubstreete in Comitatu predicto butcher & Gilbertus Borne de whitcrosse street in Comitatu predicto butcher & manuceperunt pro Iohanne Lynsey de parochia sancti Andree vndershafte London butcher pro…butcher: underlined videlicet vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena xx li. et predictus Iohannes Lynsey assumpsit pro seipsso sub pena xl li. quas concesserunt de bonis cattallis terris & Tenementis suis & Cuiuslibet eorum ad opus & vsum dicti Domini Regis fieri & levari sub Condicionem quod idem Iohannes Lynsey personaliter Comparebit ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro Comitatu predicto tenendam ad respondendum &c.

for abusinge certen gentlemen att the play howse
called the fortune.
For John Lynsey 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 345.

memorandum quod xxvjto die ffebruarij Anno regni Domini nostri Iacobi dei gracia Regis Anglie &c. viijo & Scotie xliiijto venerunt coram nobis Lodovico Lewkenour & Roberto Leigh militibus duobus Iusticiariorum pacis in Comitatu predicto conservandam assignatorum &c. Iohannes Shawe de Grubestreet in Comitatu predicto butcher & Gilbertus Borne de whitcrosse streete in Comitatu predicto butcher & manuceperunt pro Radulpho Brewyn de parochia sancti Clementes Eastcheap London butcher probutcher: underlined videlicet vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena xx. li. et predictus Radulphus assumpsit pro seipsso sub pena xl li. quas concesserunt de bonis cattallis terris & Tenementis suis & Cuiuslibet eorum ad opus & vsum dicti Domini Regis fieri & levari sub Condicionem quod idem Radulphus personaliter Comparebit ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro Comitatu Middlesexie predicto tenendam ad respondendum &c../

for abusinge certen gentlemen. att the play howse
called the fortune.
venit & exoneratur
For Ralph Brewyn 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 345.

body.head: single mb* (4 June) (Recognizance to appear and give evidence)

div.ab:
Memorandum quod quarto Die Iunij, Anno Regni Domini Nostri Iacobi Dei gracia Angliæ, ffraunciæ & Hiberniæ Regis fidei Defensoris &c. Nono et Scotiæ quadragessimo quarto, veniet ibd Coram me Lodouico Lewkenor Milite vno Iusticiariorum Dicti Domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu predicto Conservandam assignatorum
Thomas Turner of Great Leaver in Lancaster yeoman
Thomas…yeoman: underlined et recognovit se Debere Dicto Domino Regi viginti Libras bone et Legalis monete Angliæ, Quam quidem die summam viginti Librarum recognovit Leuari De bonis et Cattallis terris et Tenementis suis ad opus Dicti Domini Regis Haredum vel Successorumsuorum si Defecerit in condicione

The condicione to appeare at the next Sessiones houlden for this County there to preferre a byll of indictment and give evidence against William Knight being suspected to haue picked out of his pockett a purse with a key and five pounds in mony out of his pockett at the playe howse in Gouldinge Laine

For the indictment of William Knight, and his appearance on the Newgate Gaol Delivery following, see MJ/SR/0503/226 and MJ/GBR/001, f 163v. For Thomas Turner 's appearance to give evidence at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 387. The playhouse was the Fortune, in Golding Lane, Finsbury.

body.head: single mb* (4 June) (Presentment and indictment for theft)

div.ab: Iuratores pro domino Rege presentant quod Willelmus Knight ponit se non culpabilis ne recessit nuper de London yoman simul cum alijs quarto die Iunij Anno regni Domini nostri Iacobi Dei gracia Regis Anglie ffrancie & Hibernie fidei Defensoris &c. Nono et Scotie Quadragesimo quarto vi & armis &c. Vnum bursum Correi vocatum a white lather purse ad valenciam vnius Denarij & quatuor libras in pecunijs numeratis in eodem burso existentis de bonis Cattallis & denariis Thome Turner apud Goldinglane in predicto Comitatu Middlesexie a persona prefata Thome Clam & secrete & sine noticia ipsius Thome ad tunc & ibidem felonice furatus fuit, Cepit & Asportauit Contra pacem dicti domini Regis &c.

According to MJ/SR/0503/197, this alleged theft took place at the playhouse in Golding Lane, ie, the Fortune. For Thomas Turner 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 387; for William Knight's appearance on Newgate Gaol Delivery following, see MJ/GBR/001, f 163v.

memorandum quod nono die Aprilis Anno Regni domini nostri Iacobi dei gracia Regis Anglie &c. decimo et Scotie xlvto venit Coram me Roberto Leigh milite vno Iusticiariorum pacis in Comitatu predicto Conservandam assignatorum &c. Thomas Downton de parochia Sancti Egiddij extra Criplegate london generosus et manucepit pro Willielmo Stratford de eadem generoso sub pena x li. et predictus Willelmus assumpsit pro seipso sub pena xx li. Quas Concesserunt de bonis Catallis terris et tenementis suis et vtriusque eorum ad opus et vsum dicti domini Regis fieri et levari Sub Condicionem quod predictus Willelmus Stratford personaliter Comparebit ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro Comitatu predicto tenendam ad respondendum
for hurting one Henry Saunders a porter for…porter: line begins in the left margin
at Hoggesdon

For the appearance of William Stratford at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 506. Both he and Thomas Downton were actors at the Fortune playhouse. Robert Davenport of St Botolph (either the church at Billingsgate, without Aldersgate or without Bishopsgate), London, and John Veyseie or Voysey of Lambeth, Surrey, gentlemen, were also both accused of wounding Henry Saunders, porter (MJ/SR/0512/169 and 170). Because of his appearance with two actors, Robert Davenport may have been the dramatist writing for Prince Henry's Men at the Fortune (Mark Eccles, 'Brief Lives: Tudor and Stuart Authors. Text and Studies, 1982,' Studies in Philology 79 (1982), 36).

Memorandum quod xxxjo Die Augustij Anno Regni Domini nostri Iacobi Dei gracia Anglie ffrancie et Hibernie Regis fidei Defensoris &c. ximo & Scotie xlvjo
Richardus Grace De Barbican in parochia Richardus…parochia: underlined sancti Egidij extra Crippelgate in Comitatu Middlesexie generosus in propria persona sua venit Coram me Nicholao Bestney Armigero vno Iusticiariorum Dicti Domini Regis ad pacem &c. Conservandam assignatororum & assumpsit pro seipso sub pena quadraginta librarum Iohannes Shambrowghe De eadem generosus & Richardus Harberte De eadem Buttermaker & tunc & ibidem in proprijs personis suis similiter venerunt & manuceperunt pro predicto Richardo Grace videlicet quilibet eorum separatem sub pena viginti Librarum quod idem Richardus personaliter Comparebit Coram Iusticiarijs Dicti Domini Regis ad pacem ad proximam generalem sessionem pacis in Comitatu predicto &c. Et quod predictus Richardus interim geret pacem erga Dictum Dominum Regem & Cunctum populum suum &c. Quas &c. Si &c../.

Condicon to appeare at this session for beinge taken in the watch
late in the nighte & for beinge Druncke/
169 Nicholas Bestney
For Richard Grace 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/001, p 554. Both Richard Grace and John Shambrowghe or Shambrooke were players, the former at the Fortune playhouse.

body.head: single mb* (5 June) (Presentment and indictment for an assault at the Fortune playhouse)

div.ab: Iuratores pro Domino Rege super sacramentum suum presentant quod Ricardus Bradley Cognouit nuper de parochia sancti Iacobi apud Clarkenwell in Comitatu Middlesexie yeoman quinto Die Iunij Anno Regni Domini nostri Iacobi dei gracia Regis Anglie ffrancie et Hibernie fidei Defensoris &c. vndesimo et Scotie quadragesimo sexto Vi et armis &c. apud le ffortune prope Gouldinglane in parochia sancti Egidij extra Creplegate in Comitatu predicto in et super quadam Nicholaum Bestney Iunior generosum adtunc et ibidem in pacem dei et dicti Domini Regis existentem violenter & malitiose insultum fecit Et quod predictus Ricardus Bradley Cum quodam Cultello Anglice a knife ad valenciam vnius obuli quem ipse idem Ricardus Bradley in manu sua Dextra ad tunc et ibidem habuit et tenuit prefatum Nicholaum Besney in et super dextrum pectus Corporis ipsius Nicholai Bestney prope mamillam Dextram eiusdem pectoris Anglice the Righte papp ipsius Nicholai Bestney et similiter quod predictus Ricardus Bradley instantisinstauit instantis: for instauit adtunc et ibidem Cum Cultello predicto prefatum Nicholaum Bestney in et super sinistram partem ventris prope vmbillicum Anglice the Navell ipsius Nicholai Bensney violenter et malitiose percussit et pupigit Anglice did stobb & shreiste dans eidem Nicholao Bestney attunc et ibidem Cum Cultello predicto duas plagas Crudeles Anglice two grevious woundes vnam plagarum illarum in et super dextrum pectus Corporis ipsius Nicholai Bestney prope mamillam suam Dextram et alteram plagarum illarum in et super sinistram partem ventris sui prope vmbillicum suum de quibus quidem Crudelibus plagis predictis predictus Nicholaus Bestney a prefato Quinto die Iunij Annis supradictis vsque diem Capcionis huius inquisicionis scilicet xxxum Diem Iunij Annis supradictis languebat et adhuc egro et moraliter languidus existit ad graue Dampnum ipsius Nicholai Bestney in magnum gravamen et periculum vite sue et Contra pacem Dicti Domini Regis nunc Coronam et dignitatem suas./
per Cognitionem suam in aperta Curia

ab.hi: procuraturtriac' [taxacio finis quia pars in periculo mortis & remandatus prisone sine mancupacione vsque proximam

div.ab: For Richard Bradley's appearance at the Newgate Gaol Delivery of 30 June, see MJ/GBR/001, f 224. Nicholas Bestney junior was presumably related to Nicholas Bestney esquire, one of the Middlesex justices of the peace. Excerpted in EPT, p 544, Middlesex County Records, vol 2, pp 88—9.

Memorandum quod xxvjto die ffebruarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie &c. xjo Et Scotie xlvijo Coram ffrancisco Michell Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. venerunt Willelmus ffrende de sancte Katherine in Comitatu Middlesexie
Comitatu Middlesexie: inserted into space left blank; 35mm filled with line-fillers Alebrewer & Willelmus Perry de parochia sancti Buttolphi extra Aldersgate London yeoman & manuceperunt pro Christofero Bletcher de parochia sancti Clementis Dacorum in Comitatu Middlesexie viz. vterque eorum separatim sub pena xx li. quod ipse personaliter Comparebit Coram Iusticiarium &c. Ad proximam Sessionem in dicto Comitatu tenendam & quod ipse interim erga dictum Domium Regem & Cunctum populum suum se bene geret &c. Quas &c. Si &c.
ffor making an affraye and a tumult at the
ffortune Playhouse./
For Christopher Bletcher 's name bailed to appear at the Sesssions following, see MJ/SBR/002, p 47.

Memorandum quod 24o die Decembris Anno Regni domini nostri Iacobi dei gracia Regis Anglie &c. xijo et Scotie 48o coram me Nicholao Collyn Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in comitatu middlesexie &c. Charolus Mercy de parochia sancti Egidij extra Cripplegate London generosus et Ricardus Moreton Moreton: inserted into space previously left blank de London Iremonger manuceperunt pro Iohanne Shanke de dicta parochia sancti Egidij in dicto comitatu Middlesexie generoso quod comparebit ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro dicto comitatu middlesexie tenendam ad respondendum omnibus &c. vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena xx libras et predictus Iohannes Shanke assumpsit pro seipso sub pena xxx libras quas &c. Si &c./
Bound ouer to answer the complaint of one Henry Udall\

ab.hi: venit et exoneratur ad Deliberacionem gaole proximam

div.ab: For recognizances for Henry Uvedall to appear and give evidence, see MJ/SR/0537/109, p 174–7. For John Shanke's appearance at the Sessions and on the Newgate Gaol Delivery following, see MJ/SBR/002, p 152, and MJ/GBR/002, f 40. Charles Mercy or Marcy and John Shanke or Shankes were players at the Fortune playhouse in Golding Lane, St Giles without Cripplegate, which is referred to in the Gaol Delivery entry.

Memorandum quod 5o die ffebruarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie xvijo coram ffrancisco Michell Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. venerunt Ricardus Gonnell De whitcrostreet in dicto comitatu generosus et Willimus Bourne de Greye Inn Lane in dicto comitatu generosus et manuceperunt pro Willimo Bourne nuper de Graye Inn lane predicto generoso vizt. vterque eorum separatim sub pena 50 li. quod Dictus Willimus personaliter comparebit coram Iusticiarium &c. apud proximam Sessionem pacis pro dicto comitatu tenendam ad respondendum &c. Quas &c.
Si &c.

To answere the woundinge of
Iohn Dickinson Dickinson: written over erasure

For William Bourne 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/003, p 198. Richard Gonnell and William Bourne were players at the Fortune playhouse. The second William Bourne was possibly a son of the first William.

Memorandum quod 5o die ffebruarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie xvijo coram ffrancisco Michell Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. venerunt Ricardus Gunnell de whitcrostreet in dicto comitatu generosus, Willimus Bourne de Greye Inn Lane in dicto comitatu generosus et manuceperunt pro Ricardo Grace de goldinglane generosous videlicet vterque eorum separatim sub pena 50 li. quod Dictus Ricardus personaliter comparebit coram Iusticiarium &c. apud proximam Sessionem pacis pro dicto comitatu tenendam ad respondendum &c. Quas &c. Si &c.
To answere the woundinge of
Iohn Dickinson Dickinson: ickinson written over erasure
For Richard Grace 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/003, p 198. Richard Gonnell, William Bourne, and Richard Grace were players at the Fortune playhouse.

Memorandum quod 5o ffebruarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie xvijo coram ffrancisco Michell Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. venerunt Ricardus Gonnell de whitcrostreet in dicto comitatu generosus et Willimus Bourne de Greye Inn lane in dicto comitatu generosus et manuceperunt pro Thoma Bourne nuper de Goldinglane in dicto comitatu generoso generoso: final o written over another letter vizt. vterque eorum separatim sub pena 50 li. quod dictus Thomas comparebit coram Iusticiarium &c. apud proximam Sessionem pacis pro dicto comitatu tenendam ad respondendum &c. Quas &c. Si &c.
To answere the woundinge of
Iohn Dickinson Dickinson: ickinson written over erasure
For Thomas Bourne 's appearance at the Sessions following, see MJ/SBR/003, p 198. Richard Gonnell and William Bourne were players at the Fortune playhouse. Thomas Bourne was possibly William's son.

Memorandum quod Decimo Die Ianuarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie &c. Decimo Octavo et Scocie quinquagesimo Quarto coram Henrico Banister Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. venit Willelmus Gwalter De Clerkenwell in Comitatu Middlesexie et recognovit se Debere Dicto Domino regi x li. De bonis et Cattallis Terris et Tenementis suis fieri et leveri sub Condicione quod ipse personaliter comparebit coram Iusticiarium ad proximam Sessionem pacis pro Dicto comitatu Tenendam
ffor keeping of a Mastie Dogge knowen
to Doe harme and suffering of him to goe
vntied and hurtinge of Iames Wren./

William Gwalter does not appear at the Sessions following, but on those of 13 February 1621/2, and 27 March 1622 (MJ/SBR/003, pp 413 and 423). He was probably the man who held shares in the Fortune Theatre (Bentley, Jacobean and Caroline Stage, vol 2, p 458).

Memorandum quod viijo die Ianuarij Anno Regni Regis Iacobi nunc Anglie &c. xixo Aminadabus ffrith de parochia Sancti Egidij extra Creplegate Victualer in propria persona sua venit coram me Ricardo Lowther Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c. assignatorum et recognouit se debere domino Regi summam xl li. Charolus Massye de eadem yeoman et Matheus Dodds de parochia Sancti Austinus in Ciuitate Londiniensis Marchanttaylor silitersimiliter siliter: for similiter; mark of abbreviation missing venerunt et manuceperunt pro predicto Aminadabo separaliter per se sub pena xx li. quas separalis summas xx li. concesserunt de terris &c. levari si ipse idem Amynadabus defecerit in CondioneCondicione Condione: for Condicione; mark of abbreviation missing sequente

That the said Aminadab ffrith shall personally appeare at ye next Sessions
and to aunsweer for ye Harbouring and receiueng of those persons who
afterwards were found to be ye felons of the goods of Mr Thomas Bondes
vpon Examinacion before Master Recorder and in the meane tyme to be of
good behauyour.

For Aminadab Frythe 's name bailed to appear at the Sessions following see MJ/SBR/003, p 405. Charles Massey (Marcey) was probably the player at the Fortune. ' Master Recorder ' is the Recorder of the City of London, Heneage Finch.

Memorandum quod Willielmus Meadman de parochia Sancti Oliues in Southwark in Comitatu Surry brushmaker et Edwardus Legg de parochia sancti Georgi in Comitatu predicto
Weauer Weauer: written over erasure venerunt coram Carolo Walcot armigero vno Iusticiariorum ad pacem in middlesexie predicto iijo Die Augusti Anno Regni Regis Domini nostri Iacobi Anglie &c. xxijo et Scotie lviijo et recognouerunt separatim debere dicto domino regi xx li. de bonis et Catellis terris et tenementis suis fieri &c. &c. Sub hac condicione quod Iohannes Gardnor de parochia sancti Stephani in Coleman streete Londoni Looking-glass-maker personaliter Comparebit primo die proximam Sessionem pacis in Comitatu predicto tenendam et non recedatur abinde sine Licencia ad respondendum de hijs que tunc et ibidem versus eum obijcentur ex parte dicti domini Regis et si &c. tunc &c.
For making a tumult and an vproare
in the Fortune playehouse

This recognizance for a 'tumult' at the Fortune playhouse is almost identical to MJ/SR/0630/88, except for the name of the man charged, John Christian, instead of John Gardnor. For their names bailed to appear at the Sessions, see MJ/SBR/004, p 190.

Memorandum quod Willielmus Meademan de parochia Oliues in Southwark in Comitatu Surry brushmaker et Eduardus Legg de parochia Sancti Georgi in Comitatu predicto Weauer venerunt coram Carolo Walcot armigero vno Iusticiariorum ad pacem in Comitatu middlesexie predicto iijo die Augusti Anno Regni Regis domini nostri Iacobi Anglie &c. xxijo et Scotie lviijo et recognouerunt seperatim debere dicto domino Regi xx li. de bonis et Catellis terris et tenementis suis fieri &c. Sub hac condicione quod Iohannes Christian de eadem brushmaker personaliter Comparebit primo Die proximam Sessionem pacis in Comitatu predicto tenendum et non recedatur ab inde sine Licencia ad respondendum de hijs que tunc et ibidem versus eum obijcentur ex parte dicti domini Regis et si &c. tunc &c.
For making a tumult and an vproare in the
ffortune play house

This is almost identical to MJ/SR/0630/87, except for the name of the man charged, John Christian, instead of John Gardnor. On the 15 August, six different men were taken by the watch of Goulding Lane after midnight 'in suspicious manner,' which may have been connected with this uproar (MJ/SR/0630/89–93, 95). For the appearances of John Christian and John Gardnor at the Sessions, see MJ/SBR/004, p 190.

Memorandum quod Thomas Collins De Dukes-place London Glouer Henricus Gillingham de eadem glouer et Iosephus Bradford de eadem Glouer Venerunt coram Carolo Walcot armigero vno Iusticiariorum ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie secundo Die Nouembris Anno Regni Domini nostri Iacobi Anglie &c. xxijo et Scotie lviijo et recognouerunt se debere dicto domino [ Regi videlicet predictus Thomas Collins xx li. Henricus Gillingham et Iosephus Bradford recognouerunt separatim x li. de bonis et cattalis terris et tenementis suis fieri &c.. Sub hac condicione quod predictus Thomas Collins personaliter Comparebit primo die proximam Sessionem pacis in Comitatu predicto tenendam et non recedatur ab inde sine Licencia ad respondendum de hijs que tunc et ibidem versus eum obijcentur ex parte dicti domini Regis si &c. tunc &c.
To be of good behauiour at the Complaint
of the officers of the ffortune plaiehouse./
For Thomas Collins 's appearance at the Sessions on 6 December following see MJ/SBR/004, p 226.

MemoranddumMemorandum
Memoranddum : for Memorandum quod secundo Die Maij Anno regni Regis nostri Caroli Anglie &c primo Ricardus Gunnell De goldenlaine in Comitatu predicto generosus et Rolandus Baylyffe De whitecrostreet in Comitatu predicto vintner in proprius personis suis venerunt coram me Ricardo Lowther Armigero vno Iusticiariorum &c assignatorum et recognouerunt se Debere Dicto Domino Regi separales summas viginti librarum quas concesserunt De terris &c ad vsum Dicti Domini Regis &c leuari sub Condicione sequente, quod Iackamenta Sparke uxor Thome Sparke De Loathberry Sissor personaliter comparet apud proximam Sessionem pacis pro Comitatu predicto ad tenendam et interim pacem conseruat erga Dictum Dominum Regem et cunctum populum suum et precipue erga Mariam Parker uxorem Iohannis Parker De whitecrostreet founder
pro pace per supersidias
Richard Gunnell was manager of the Fortune playhouse. Jacamenta, wife of Thomas Sparkes, was bailed to appear at the Sessions following (MJ/SBR/004, p 289).

Memorandum quod decimo octauo die Maij Anno Regni domini nostri Caroli dei gracia Anglie Scotie ffrauncie & Hibernie Regis fidei defensoris &c secundo venerunt Coram me Georgio Longe Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie conseruandam assignatorum Robertus ffranke de Blackwall in parochia de Stepne in Comitatu Middlesexie saylor et Willelmus Collison de eadem sayler in proprijs personis suis et manuceperunt pro Patriaco Gray de Blackwall predicto in Comitatu Middlesexie saylor vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena quinquaginta librarum et predictus Patriacus assumpsit pro seipso sub pena Centum marcarum quas concesserunt de bonis et catallis terris et tenementis suis ad vsum dicti domini Regis fieri et leuari si defecerint in Condicione subsequente./
The Condicion of this Recognizance ys such that if the aboue bounden Pattricke Gray do personally appere at the next Sessions of the peace to be holden for this County of Middlesex And then answere such matters as shalbe obiected against him touchinge His misdemenor in A [dangerous Ryott att the ffortune playhouse & callinge to his ffellow saylors to knocke them all downe [that were present And departe not thence without licence of the Court that then this Recognizance to be void or els to stand & remaine in full force & vertue./

Patrick Gray was bailed to appear at the sessions of 23 May and appeared on the Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May 1626 (MJ/SBR/004, p 396 and MJ/GBR/003, f 171v). The recognizances of two other men who appeared at the Newgate Gaol Delivery, John Lee and Thomas Hastings , have not survived, but their names appear on the same Gaol Delivery Roll, MJ/GBR/003, ff 171v and 177v.

Memorandum quod xviijo die Maij Anno Regni domini nostri Caroli dei gracia Anglie Scotie ffrancie et Hibernie Regis fidei defensoris &c secundo venerunt Coram me Georgio Longe Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie conseruandam assignatorum Lawrencius Davige parochie sancti Andree in Holborne in Comitatu Middlesexie generosus et Iohannes Kerbye de Blackwall parochie de Stepney in Comitatu predicto victualler in proprijs personis suis et manuceperunt pro Willelmo Collison de Blackwall predicte vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena quinquaginta librarum et dictus Willelmus assumpsit pro seipso sub pena Centum marcarum quas concesserunt de bonis et catallis terris et tenementis suis ad vsum Dicti Domini Regis fieri et levari si defecerint in Condicione subsequente./
The Condicion of this Recognizance ys such That if ye abouenamed William Collison doe personally appeare at ye next Sessions of ye peace to bee holden for this County And then answere such matters as shalbe obiected against him conceringe a dangerous & greate Ryott comitted in whitecrosstreet at þe fortune playhouse And for assultinge & strickinge of Edward Heather ye Headboroughe And in ye meane time bee of the good behaviour towards his Maiestie and all his leidge people and Departe not thence without licence of ye Courte That then this Recognizance to bee voyde or ells to stand and remaine in full force & vertue./
William Collison was bailed to appear at the Sessions of the Peace of 23 May, and the Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May 1626 (MJ/SBR/004, p 396, and MJ/GBR/003, f 171v).

Memorandum quod decimo octavo die Maij Anno Regni domini nostri Caroli dei gracia Anglie Scotie ffrancie et Hibernie Regis fidei defensoris &c secundo venerunt Coram me Georgio Longe Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie conseruandam assignatorum Willelmus Smyth parochie sancte Margarete Westmonastarij in Comitatu Middlesexie yeoman et Iohannes Gylbie de Blackwall parochie de Stepney in Comitatu predicto purser in proprijs personis suis et manuceperunt pro Roberto ffrancke de Blackwall in parochia predicte sayler vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena quinquaginta librarum et dictus Robertus ffrancke assumpsit pro seipso sub pena Centum marcarum quas concesserunt de bonis et Catallis terris et tenementis suis ad vsum dicti domini Regis fieri et levari si defecerint in Condicione subsequente./
The Condicion of this Recognizance is such That if ye abouenamed Robert ffrancke do personally appere at ye next Sessions of ye peace to bee holden for this County And then answere such matters as shalbee obiected against him touchinge a dangerous & greate Ryott comitted in whitecrosstreet at ye ffortune playhouse And for givinge out yat if they ye saylers were not putt in a stronger house then ye New prison they would ʌall bee fetched out before the next morowe And in ye meane time bee of ye good behaviour towards his Maiestie and all his Leidge people And Departe not thence without Licence of ye Courte That then this Recognizance to bee voyde or ells to stand & remaine in full force & vertue./
For Robert Francke 's appearance at the Sessions of the Peace of 23 May, and Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May 1626, see MJ/SBR/004, p 396, and MJ/GBR/003, f 171v.

Memorandum quod xvjo die Maij Anno Regni domini nostri Caroli dei gracia Anglie Scotie ffrancie et Hibernie Regis fidei defensoris &c secundo venerunt coram me Georgio Longe Armigero vno Iusticiariorum Dicti Domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie conseruandam assignatorum Iacobus Carver parochie de Stepney in Comitatu Middlesexie sailer et Willelmus ffoster parochie predicte Cordwayner ʌin proprijs personis suis et manuceperunt pro Thoma Alderson parochie de Stepney predicte sayler vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena quinquaginta librarum et dictus Thomas Alderson assumpsit pro seipso sub pena Centum marcarum quas concesserunt de bonis et Catallis terris et tenementis suis ad vsum Dicti domini Regis fieri et levari si defecerint in Condicione subsequente./
The Condicion of this Recognizance is such That if ye abouenamed Thomas Alderson doe personally appeare at ye next Sessions of ye peace to bee holden for this County And then answere such matters as shalbee obiected against him touchinge a daungerous & greate Ryott committed in Whitecrosstreete at the fortune playhouse And for ioyninge with ye rest of ye Riottours in beatinge & assaltinge of Thomas ffalkener an Inhabitant at ye fortune playehouse And beinge charged in the kings name to yeelde & keepe ye peace hee saide hee cared not for ye kinge , for ye kinge paide them noe wages & therefore hee Cared not And further sayinge hee would bringe ye whole Navy thither to pull downe ye playehouse . And in ye meane time bee of :the good behaviour towards his Maiestie & all his Leidge people And departe not thence without Licence of ye Courte That then this Recognizance to bee voyde or ells to stand & remaine in full force & vertue./

This recognizance casts an interesting light on the political situation and unrest of the day, ie, that the sailors in the king's navy were angry at not being paid their wages. Thomas Alderson was bailed to appear at the following Sessions of the Peace, and appeared at Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May 1626 (MJ/SBR/004, p 395, and MJ/GBR/003, f 171v).

Memorandum quod decimosexto die Maij Anno Regni domini nostri Caroli dei gracia Anglie Scotie ffrancie et Hibernie Regis fidei defensoris &c secundo venerunt coram me Georgio Longe Armigero vno Iusticiariorum dicti domini Regis ad pacem in Comitatu Middlesexie conseruandam assignatorum Robertus Herringe de Shadwell in parochie de Stepney in Comitatu Middlesexie Chirurgeon et Willelmus Smyth parochie sancti Margarete Westmonastarij in Comitatu predicto yeoman in proprijs personis suis et manuceperunt pro Iacobo Carver de Shadwell predicte vizt. vterque manucaptorum predictorum sub pena quinquaginta librarum et Dictus Iacobus Carver assumpsit pro seipso sub pena Centum marcarum quas concesserunt de bonis et Catallis terris et tenementis suis ad vsum dicti Domini Regis fieri et levari si defecerint in Condicione subsequente./
The Condicion of this Recognizance is such yat if ye abouenamed Iames Carver doe personally appeare at ye next Sessions of ye peace to bee holden for this County And then answere such matters as shalbee obiected against him touchinge a daungerous & greate Ryott committed in whitecrosstreete at the fortune playhouse and especially for strikinge beatinge & assaltinge ffrancis ffoster the Constable & Thomas ffalkner an Inhabitant at ye fortune playhouse And in ye meane time bee of: the good behaviour towards his Maiestie and all his Leidge people And depart not thence without Licence of ye Courte That then this Recognizance to bee voyde or ells to stand & remaine in full force & vertue./

For James Carver 's commital to Newgate at the following Sessions of the Peace, and appearance at Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May and 5 July 1626, see MJ/SBR/004, p 395, and MJ/GBR/003, ff 171v and 177v.

head.title: Register of Prisoners Delivered for Trial

row.cell:
Venit et exoneratur
Iohannes Shanke de parochia sancti Egidij extra Criplegate generosus for buyinge fower Networke bandes & a paire of Cuffes at the playhouse at an vnder rate being part of the goodes stolne from Henry Vdall.

cell.note: Idem: Nicholas Collyn, justice of the peace

row.cell:
Venit et exoneratur
Henricus Vdall de Le Strond yoman

cell.note: Idem: Francis Mitchell, justice of the peace

row.cell:
Venit et exoneratur
Willelmus fflood de Westmonasterio generosus
Idem

Venit et exoneratur
Edwardus Vdall de Le Drury lane vitler
Idem

Venit et exoneratur
Richard Coulton de Le Strond yoman
Idem

div.ab: For John Shanke's and Henry Uvedall 's recognizances to appear, and for further sureties for Henry Uvedall to appear and give evidence, see MJ/SR/0537/108, 109 and 174–77. For John Shanke's appearance at the Sessions, see MJ/SBR/002, p 152. Charles Mercy/Marcy/Massey and John Shanke were actors appearing at the Fortune which is probably the playhouse referred to above.

head.title: Middlesex Sessions of the Peace Registers

note.add: An order for suppressinge of Jigges att the ende of playes:/

div.ab: Whereas Complaynte have beene made at this last generall Sessions that by reason of Certayne lewde Jiggs songes & daunces vsed & accustomed at the play house Called the ffortune in Gouldinglane divers Cuttpurses & other lewde & ill disposed persons in greate multitudes doe resorte thither at thend of euerye playe many tymes causinge tumultes & outrages wherebye his Maiestes peace is often broke & much mischiefe like to ensue thereby Itt was herevpon expresselye Commanunded & ordered by the Iustices of the sayd benche That all Actors of euerye playehouse within this Cittye & liberties thereof & in the Countye of Middlesex that they & euerie of them vtterlye abolishe all Jigges Rymes & daunces after theire playes And not to tollerate permitt or suffer anye of them to be vsed vpon payne of ymprisonment & puttinge downe & suppressinge of theire playes And such further punishment to be inflicted vpon them as theire offences shall deserve And that if anye outrage tumult or like disorder as aforesaid should be Committed or done that then the partyes so offendinge should forthwith be apprehended & punished accordinge to theire demeritt ffor the better suppressinge of which abuses and outrages These are to will & require you & in his Maiesties name streightelye to Charge & commaunde you that you dilignetly & stryctlye looke vnto the performaunce of the same order And that if either ye players doe persiste & Contynewe theire sayd Jiggs daunces or songes as aforesaid or any disordered persons doe Committ or attempt any violence or outrage in or about the said playehouses That then you apprehend all & euerie such person of either kynde so offendinge and forthwith bringe them before me or some other of his Maiestes Iustices of ye peace to answeare theire Contemptes & further to be dealt with as to Iustice shall appertayne./
For Thomas Charsley's recognizance, see MJ/SR/0515/83.

head.title: Middlesex Sessions of the Peace Registers

div.ab:
venit et Recognovit Certificatur ad deliberandum gaole.
Iohannes Shancke de Santi Giles extra Cripplegate generosus ad respondendum omnibus &c.

For John Shanke 's recognizance to appear and his appearance at the Gaol Delivery of 16 January, see MJ/SR/0537/108 and MJ/GBR/2, f 40. He was a player at the Fortune playhouse. Nicholas Collyn was the justice of the peace.

head.title: Middlesex Sessions of the Peace Registers

row.cell:
venit et exoneratur
Willelmus George de Moorelane Londinium carrman

cell.note: Idem: George Longe, justice of the peace

row.cell: Committitur Newgate. Iacobus Carver de Shadwell

cell.note: Idem: George Longe, justice of the peace

row.cell: Thomas Alderson de Stephney sailour
Idem
Ricardus Margrave de Wappinge sailour
Idem

Robertus ffrancke de Blackwall
for a riott at the ffortune play house

Willelmus Collison de eadem
pro consimile
Idem

Patricius Gray de eadem
pro consimile
Idem

div.ab: For the recognizances of James Carver and Thomas Alderson to appear at the Sessions of the Peace, see MJ/SR/649/57–8. For the recognizances of Robert Francke, William Collison, and Patrick Gray to appear at the Sessions of the Peace, see MJ/SR/0649/53 and MJ/SR/0649/55–6. For Gray's appearance at the Newgate Gaol Delivery of 24 May 1626, see MJ/GBR/003, f 171v.

head.title: Middlesex Sessions of the Peace Registers

div.ab:
Venit & exoneratur
Ricardus Gunnill de goulding lane generosus

ab.note: Idem: Simon Muskett, justice of the peace

div.ab: For Richard Gunnill 's earlier recognizance, see MJ/SR/0692/84. He was a sharer in the Fortune playhouse, and later built the Salisbury Court playhouse.
